de.esoco.lib.net

Class MACAddress

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.net.MACAddress
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class MACAddress
extends org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    Immutable datatype class for network adapter MAC addresses. A MAC address consists of 6 bytes that identify a network adapter.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MACAddress(byte[] rBytes)
      Creates a new instance from a byte array.
      MACAddress(byte b1, byte b2, byte b3, byte b4, byte b5, byte b6)
      Creates a new instance from 6 byte values in transmission order.
      MACAddress(java.lang.String sMAC)
      Creates a new instance from a string representation of the MAC address.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getBytes()
      Returns the bytes of this MAC address in a new byte array in transmission order.
      static byte[] parseBytes(java.lang.String sMAC)
      Parses the bytes of a MAC address string and returns a new array containing the bytes in transmission order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MACAddress

        public MACAddress(java.lang.String sMAC)
        Creates a new instance from a string representation of the MAC address.
        Parameters:
        sMAC - A string containing the MAC address
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the format of the argument string is invalid

      • MACAddress

        public MACAddress(byte[] rBytes)
        Creates a new instance from a byte array. The array must contain exactly 6 bytes in transmission order.
        Parameters:
        rBytes - An array containing the 6 bytes of the MAC address
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument array is NULL or does not contain exactly 6 bytes

      • MACAddress

        public MACAddress(byte b1,
                  byte b2,
                  byte b3,
                  byte b4,
                  byte b5,
                  byte b6)
        Creates a new instance from 6 byte values in transmission order.
        Parameters:
        b1 - Byte 1
        b2 - Byte 2
        b3 - Byte 3
        b4 - Byte 4
        b5 - Byte 5
        b6 - Byte 6

    • Method Detail

      • parseBytes

        public static byte[] parseBytes(java.lang.String sMAC)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses the bytes of a MAC address string and returns a new array containing the bytes in transmission order.
        Parameters:
        sMAC - The MAC address string to parse
        Returns:
        A new array containing the MAC address bytes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument string is NULL or has an invalid format

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Returns the bytes of this MAC address in a new byte array in transmission order.
        Returns:
        A new array containing the bytes of the MAC address
